content: tunisian box hat by amelia garripoli tunisian crochet is also called afghan stitch it builds a unique structure you will work back and forth on your work and never turn it over the right side of your work is always facing you gauge is much looser than either knitting or crochet each row is formed with two passes the forward pass and the return pass the forward pass you will be working right to left and the return pass you will work left to right tunisian crochet box hat materials 2 ounces baah sonoma dk in color a 2 ounces baah sonoma dk in color b size j afghan hook 10 or longer can use a regular size j crochet hook if you keep the stitches close together on it yarn needle & scissors pattern sizes given are medium small/child large/male if you d like a rolled brim add 8 more stitches to the original cast-on and work 32 32 38 stitches across on each row cast-on row begin with color a make a slip knot and chain 26 26 30 row 1 forward pass using color a in the underside loop of each stitch on the chain except the one on the hook pull a loop through do a forward pass using the underside loops 26 26 30 stitches on the hook row 1 return pass start color b do a return pass pull a loop through the first loop on the needle dropping that loop until the end of the row pull a loop through two loops on the needle dropping both end with one loop on the hook row 2 forward pass using color b do a forward pass pull a loop through the second-to- last vertical bar on the last row leaving it on the hook continue pulling a loop through each bar and leaving it on the hook until you reach the final bar of the previous row pull the last loop through the last bar and the last first horizontal thread to create a chain-stitch selvedge from this point on change colors each time you return to the left side of the work each color will do a return pass and a forward pass then be exchanged with the other color row 2 return pass do a return pass see row 3 © 2016 amelia garripoli
